text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello i'm sneha a cloud support engineer
here at the aws office in northern
virginia today i'm going to discuss
about alias records and how you can
create alias records for services hosted
in aws let's get started
alias records let you route traffic to
selected aws resources such as amazon
cloudfront distributions elastic load
balancers and amazon simple storage
service buckets
alias records also let you route traffic
from one record in a hosted zone to
another record
when you try to resolve an alias record
name amazon route 53 name servers will
reply with an a record for ipv4
addresses or a quadruple a record for
ipv6 addresses of the alias target as an
authoritative response
let's see how to create an alias record
using the route 53 console
after logging into the aws management
console navigate to the route 53 console
then select hosted zone from the left
side menu
here you can see all your hosted zones
choose the domain name that you want to
use
under the records section choose create
record
if you want to use a subdomain for an
alias record then provide a record name
or else keep it blank for record type
select a from the drop down list
since we are creating an alias record
click on the alias radio button on the
right
then select the aws service that you
want to select as a target from route
traffic to drop down list
i'll select alias to application and
classic load balancer for the purpose of
this demo
then select the region that your load
balancer is in from the drop down list
you'll see a new drop down list select
the load balancer from a list of load
balancers in the selected region and
then choose create records
an alias record is now created and you
can confirm by checking the hosted zone
records section
to create a cname alias record repeat
the same procedure but this time select
the record type as cname
note to create an alias record for a
cname record the alias target must
resolve to a cname value or else route
53 returns a surf fail refused return
code error
here is an example of a valid and an
invalid cname alias record
please note that a cname record can't be
created for the parent or apex domain
if you use a dns provider other than
route 53 for your domain name then you
might be able to point the domain to the
services hosted on aws 2.
check if your dns provider supports
cname record on a root domain using
techniques such as cname flattening
a name records or webhops redirection
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at aws
[Applause]
[Music]
